summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications indicating that she was employed by the committee from at least February 1977 through December 1977. The payroll certifications list her name and salary, confirming her employment during that period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but they establish her as a paid staff member.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the documents do not detail her specific contributions, her employment indicates she was involved in the committee's work during its investigation.
